abstract: Legs and feet replaced gasoline to keep power flowing at the encampment in Zuccotti Park.
snippet: Legs and feet replaced gasoline to keep power flowing at the encampment in Zuccotti Park.
lead_paragraph: Rita Moreira, a visitor from Brazil, was walking past Zuccotti Park around noon on Sunday when she stopped to gaze at a man drinking a cup of coffee and pedaling a stationary bicycle connected to several wires.

headline.main: With Generators Gone, Wall Street Protesters Try Bicycle Power
